title: My experiences with booting (FBINST win so far)

forumNotes.author: mateuszek
forumNotes.content:
I tried few diffrent methods for boot one old computer in work, 512 mb ram, smth about 1ghz proc, old bios (2004).  

1.Sandisk cruzer titanium u3 -\> boot iso on lun (usb cdrom) = system hang = not boot.  
2.Lexar pendrive -\> flipped with boot it (seen as hdd)-\> = wont boot tried many things with rmprepusb with options as 2hdd or not many combination of switches -\> not booting.  
3.Fbinst on any pendrive = boot.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
> I tried few diffrent methods for boot one old computer in work, 512 mb ram, smth about 1ghz proc, old bios (2004). > > 1.Sandisk cruzer titanium u3 -\> boot iso on lun (usb cdrom) = system hang = not boot. > 2.Lexar pendrive -\> flipped with boot it (seen as hdd)-\> = wont boot tried many things with rmprepusb with options as 2hdd or not many combination of switches -\> not booting. > 3.Fbinst on any pendrive = boot. Hi matx1212 I am interested in making RMPrepUSB better and fbinst does many 'tricks' that RMPrepUSB does not, but could you give details of your experiments pleaase? 1. What OS are you trying to boot? 2. Which commands did you use for fbinst exactly 3. Did you use grub or any other type of bootloader 4. What size were the USB drives 5. What mainboard and BIOS?
Many old boards will boot if you have a 512mb or lower USB stick and use ZIP FAT16 CHS in RMPrepUSB - did you try this? Thanks Steve

forumNotes.author: mateuszek
forumNotes.content:
Ok - I will check it tomorrow in work or in this week.  
I will check based on xp pe because vistape on such slow computer has any sense ? i think not..  

If you have any more options you would like me to check or uncheck write here.  

Propably i will use grub4dos. ok ?  
Or if you have any testing environment or some iso etc you would like me to check, send link, i will check it.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Hi  
Thanks for offering. I am interested in any scenario where fbinst works but RMPrepUSB does not on the same USB stick, same mainboard, same OS, same bootloader.  

Actually I am quite interested in WinPE v2/v3 booting or DOS/FreeDos (not from ISO).  
Thanks  
Steve

forumNotes.author: wimb
forumNotes.content:
> Actually I am quite interested in WinPE v2/v3 booting
May be Make_PE3.exe is interesting to you.  

There is now a GUI program to make pe3.iso Boot Image with GUI and Support for Portable Programs  

[http://www.911cd.net...o...21883\&st=35](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=21883&st=35 "External link")

forumNotes.author: mateuszek
forumNotes.content:
Nice but as I can see this make pe3.exe is creating ck 155mb.iso file. This mainboard in this computer is such stupid that in windows it is working like usb 2.0 but in usb boot is usb 1.1 very slow transfer.
I will try it but if you know how to make winpe 2 or 3 file smaller (much smaller, propably impossible) write here.

forumNotes.author: wimb
forumNotes.content:
> This mainboard in this computer is such stupid that in windows it is working like usb 2.0 but in usb boot is usb 1.1
You can try to increase in this case the boot speed by letting PLoP BootManager preload USB 2.0 driver.  
This option is available in GRUB4DOS Menu on USB-sticks prepared with Make_USB.exe ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)   

[http://www.msfn.org/...ooting-with-pe/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/121446-install-from-usb-after-booting-with-pe/ "External link")  

The size of pe3.iso may be cannot be decreased that much. ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png)   

BTW much faster booting is available when you install pe3.iso as GRUB4DOS boot option on HDD e.g. your C: drive.  
You can boot in 30 sec with pe3.iso loaded by GRUB4DOS from HDD and booting then from RAMDISK X:  
That is by far the best way to boot.   
Since you boot from RAMDISK, you are allowed to do everything you want (including format or restore of ghost image)   
and make the desired changes in your C: drive from which you just launched pe3.iso :wink:   

Only in case the harddisk is brandnew or damaged, then it can be necessary to boot from USB-stick.

forumNotes.author: mateuszek
forumNotes.content:
SO ok, i was wrong, sorry. FBINST may be best but may be not. 1. i made make_pe3. iso from wimb, ok, 2. run rmprepusb (checked option 1 - vistape win7pe with default settings checkboxes) 3. ok it made me partition but i wanted install grub4dos, in rmprepusb when i click install grub loader, cmd windows is shown and this command -\> grubinstcommand failed , place grubinst.exe and grldr in rmprepusb folder. But i pasted those files there. Even running PROCMON i see that they are executed and there is no such error like file or name not found. but ok i 4 installed grub4dos using bootice, loaded also plop to make it faster and win7pe on this stupid mainboard = OK run great.

so now reviewing my post fbinst is better or not ? i dont know now. GOOD WORK with RMPREPUSB and wimb makepe3 thanks all.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Thanks for the reply - Grub does not like the 'Force use of LBA calls' RMPrepUSB option as this makes a 'bad' partition table which Grub warns you about. Please untick the 'Force use of LBA calls' option and it should work OK.  

I will add the --skip-mbr-test to the command in the next version which will avoid this error message.

forumNotes.author: mateuszek
forumNotes.content: I forgot to add = this test was on ordinary normal cheap usb drive = kingston data traveler 2gb.
